channel.title: CWE-436 on ZAP
channel.description: Recent content in CWE-436 on ZAP

item.title: Charset Mismatch
item.description: This check identifies responses where the HTTP Content-Type header declares a charset different from the charset defined by the body of the HTML or XML. When there’s a charset mismatch between the HTTP header and content body Web browsers can be forced into an undesirable content-sniffing mode to determine the content’s correct character set.

item.title: Charset Mismatch (Header Versus Meta Charset)

When there’s a charset mismatch between the HTTP header and content body Web browsers can be forced into an undesirable content-sniffing mode to determine the content’s correct character set.

item.title: Charset Mismatch (Header Versus Meta Content-Type Charset)
item.description: This check identifies responses where the HTTP Content-Type header declares a charset different from the charset defined by the body of the HTML or XML. When there’s a charset mismatch between the HTTP header and content body Web browsers can be forced into an undesirable content-sniffing mode to determine the content’s correct character set.

item.title: Charset Mismatch (Meta Charset Versus Meta Content-Type Charset)
item.description: This check identifies responses where the HTTP Content-Type header declares a charset different from the charset defined by the body of the HTML or XML. When there’s a charset mismatch between the HTTP header and content body Web browsers can be forced into an undesirable content-sniffing mode to determine the content’s correct character set.
